subject: World Cup (Skiing)
lead_paragraph: The American Lindsey Vonn had the fastest time in training in Whistler, British Columbia, on Tuesday for this week’s World Cup downhill as skiers got their first look at the course that will be used for the 2010 Vancouver Olympics. Vonn, who has won four of seven World Cup downhills this season, including the opener at Lake Louise in Canada, charged down the course in 1 minute 46.54 seconds. Canada’s Britt Janyk was second fastest in 1:46.67, followed by the Frenchwoman Marie Marchand-Arvier.
